matched.actualTitle: XXE (XML External Entity) Injection in SOAP Service - Authenticated File Read
matched.matchReason: Both findings describe XXE injection vulnerability in the SOAP service endpoint. The actual finding confirms the expected vulnerability with detailed exploitation evidence showing arbitrary file read capability (flag.txt and /etc/passwd successfully extracted). Both describe unsafe XML parsing configuration allowing external entity resolution and XXE attacks.

extra.title: Werkzeug Debugger Enabled in Production with Code Execution (EVALEX=true)
extra.location: Flask application debug mode in production
extra.assessment: New discovery - This is a critical remote code execution vulnerability not in the expected findings. The debugger is enabled with EVALEX=true and exposed SECRET key, allowing arbitrary Python code execution. This is a significant security finding that should be addressed immediately.

extra.title: Verbose Error Pages Disclose Server Information
extra.assessment: New discovery - Information disclosure vulnerability not in expected findings. Error pages leak server version (Werkzeug/3.1.3 Python/3.13.3), file paths, and application structure details that facilitate reconnaissance attacks.

extra.title: Missing CSRF Protection on Login Form
extra.assessment: New discovery - CSRF protection vulnerability on login form not in expected findings. The form lacks CSRF token fields and the application accepts cross-origin POST requests without CSRF validation.

extra.title: Missing Cache-Control Headers on Logout Endpoint
extra.assessment: New discovery - Cache control vulnerability not in expected findings. Logout response lacks Cache-Control, Pragma, and Expires headers, making it vulnerable to cache poisoning attacks.

extra.title: Session Not Properly Invalidated on Logout
extra.assessment: New discovery - Session management vulnerability not in expected findings. The logout endpoint fails to send Set-Cookie headers to invalidate the session cookie, leaving valid session cookies active after logout.

extra.title: No Account Lockout or Rate Limiting on Login Attempts
extra.assessment: New discovery - Authentication security vulnerability not in expected findings. The login endpoint accepts unlimited rapid login attempts without rate limiting, account lockout, or throttling mechanisms, enabling brute force attacks.

extra.title: CSRF Vulnerability on Logout Endpoint - Logout Accepts GET Requests
extra.assessment: New discovery - CSRF and HTTP method semantics violation not in expected findings. The logout endpoint accepts GET requests (idempotent method for state-changing operation), enabling clickjacking attacks via embedded images/links.

extra.title: Missing Security Headers on Login Page
extra.assessment: New discovery - Security misconfiguration not in expected findings. Login page is missing 6 critical security headers: X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options, X-XSS-Protection, HSTS, CSP, and Referrer-Policy.

extra.title: Missing Security Headers on Logout Endpoint - Clickjacking Vulnerability
extra.assessment: New discovery - Clickjacking vulnerability not in expected findings. Logout endpoint missing X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options, X-XSS-Protection, CSP, and HSTS headers, enabling framing and other attacks.

extra.title: Credentials Transmitted Over Unencrypted HTTP
extra.assessment: New discovery - Transport layer security vulnerability not in expected findings. Login credentials transmitted over unencrypted HTTP without HTTPS support, making them vulnerable to man-in-the-middle attacks and network sniffing.

extra.title: Horizontal IDOR (Insecure Direct Object Reference) in SOAP Service
extra.assessment: New discovery - Authorization bypass vulnerability not in expected findings. SOAP service lacks authorization checks allowing authenticated users to access any account by manipulating account_id parameter, enabling unauthorized access to all user accounts and financial data.

extra.title: Missing SameSite Cookie Flag on Session Cookie - CSRF Vulnerability
extra.assessment: New discovery - CSRF vulnerability not in expected findings. Session cookie lacks SameSite attribute, allowing browser to send it with cross-origin requests and enabling CSRF attacks on state-changing operations.
